id: \n<p style="text-align: center; margin: auto;"><img style="width: 100%;" src="https://retree-hawaii.org/wp-content/uploads/2019/12/RETREE-HAWAII_TEXT.png" width="800" /></p>
\n<h3>Please Register ${Company} for Lā Hoʻoulu Pae Moku / Retree Hawaii</h3>

\n<p>We talked a while ago about ${Company} participating in the October 30 statewide tree planting, with volunteers coming to put plants in the ground and contribute to Hawai&lsquo;i's efforts to combat climate change, increase our resilience to its effects, mitigate erosion, increase shade and provide more support for our endangered native plants and animals.</p>

\n<p>It is impossible to predict just what the situation with the coronavirus and related restrictions will be on October 30,&nbsp; but we will do what we can to have a safe event based on the rules in place then. Planting outdoors with significant space between individuals is a safe activity if combined with the common best practices of cleaning tools between use or having participants bring and use their own gloves, and participants bringing their own water. Masks should be worn for briefings and whenever people need to get closer than 6-10 feet. Some sites will have multiple shifts to keep the number of volunteers present low at any given time.</p>

\n<p>The project Web site is now ready for you to register your planting site. This will allow volunteers to see which sites are available and sign up for one or more. It will also allow us to see how much coverage we have at this point and how many volunteers can be accepted.</p>

\n<p>Please go to <a href="https://retree-hawaii.org/planting/">https://retree-hawaii.org/planting/</a> and choose Register the Site to enter information about your planting site. You can come back to that Web page as often as you like to update any information there.</p>
\n<p>Registering your planting site will ask you to create an account by selecting an email address and password. This is a one-time thing to prevent hackers from changing your information.</p>
\n<p>If you have any questions or run into obstacles registering the planting site, please don't hesitate to contact us at the email address below.</p>

\n<h3>Please join us, ${Company}, for Lā Hoʻoulu Pae Moku / Retree Hawaii</h3>

\n<p>Individuals, organizations, counties and the State are gearing up to make Hawaii even more beautiful but also more resilient to climate change by planting trees and other plants across the state on October 30, 2020.</p>

\n<p>Plants in general sequester carbon and bind the soil to reduce erosion. Trees provide much-needed shade and cooling in urban and rural areas. Hawaiian native plants stabilize the watershed environments and increase the chances of survival of our endangered forest animals.</p>

\n<p>There will be planting activities across the state on October 30 - at conservation areas, parks, schools, churches, open space areas, hotels and resorts, farms and also at residential complexes such as AOAOs.</p>

\n<p>Can ${Company} identify areas to plant (and appropriate plants) on sites you manage so that volunteers from your organization or from the general public can participate on October 30, 2020 to expand our plant coverage while helping Hawai&lsquo;i and the world resist climate change?</p>

\n<p>If so, the project Web site <a href="https://retree-hawaii.org/">https://retree-hawaii.org</a> is now ready for you to register your planting site if you are able to accept volunteers on October 30 and have not yet registered. This will allow volunteers to see which sites are available and sign up for one or more.</p>

\n<p>It is impossible to predict just what the situation with the coronavirus and related restrictions will be on October 30,&nbsp; but we will do what we can to have a safe event based on the rules in place then. Planting outdoors with significant space between individuals is a safe activity if combined with the common best practices of cleaning tools between use or having participants bring and use their own gloves, and participants bringing their own water. Masks should be worn for briefings and whenever people need to get closer than 6-10 feet. Some sites will have multiple shifts to keep the number of volunteers present low at any given time.</p>

\n<p>Please go to <a href="https://retree-hawaii.org/planting/">https://retree-hawaii.org/planting/</a> and choose Register the Site to enter information about your planting site. You can come back to that Web page as often as you like to update any information there.</p>
\n<p>Registering your planting site will ask you to create an account by selecting an email address and password. This is a one-time thing to prevent hackers from changing your information.</p>
\n<p>If you have any questions or run into obstacles registering the planting site, please don't hesitate to contact us at the email address below.</p>
\n<p>If you are not able to provide access to a site where planting can happen on October 30, can you help reach others who can on ${Island}?</p>
\n<p>And help us get the word out so we have volunteers at all sites on all islands? Our goals are 1,000 sites, 10,000 volunteers and 100,000 plants across the state on October 30, 2020!</p>
\n<p>If you have any questions or run into obstacles registering the planting site, please don't hesitate to contact us at the email address below.</p>

\n<p dir="ltr" style="line-height: 1.3800000000000001; margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 0pt;"><span style="font-size: 11pt; font-family: Arial; color: #000000; background-color: transparent; font-weight: bold; font-style: italic; font-variant: normal; text-decoration: underline; -webkit-text-decoration-skip: none; text-decoration-skip-ink: none; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap;">For Immediate Release</span></p>

\n<p dir="ltr" style="line-height: 1.3800000000000001; margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 0pt;"><span style="font-size: 11pt; font-family: Arial; color: #000000; background-color: transparent; font-weight: bold; font-style: normal; font-variant: normal; text-decoration: none; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap;">Lā Ho&lsquo;oulu Paemoku / Retree Hawaii announces a statewide tree planting initiative gearing up to make Hawai&lsquo;i more resilient to climate change.</span></p>

\n<p dir="ltr" style="line-height: 1.3800000000000001; margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 0pt;"><span style="font-size: 11pt; font-family: Arial; color: #000000; background-color: transparent; font-weight: bold; font-style: normal; font-variant: normal; text-decoration: none; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap;">August 9, 2020</span></p>

\n<p dir="ltr" style="line-height: 1.3800000000000001; margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 0pt;"><span style="font-size: 11pt; font-family: Arial; color: #000000; background-color: transparent; font-weight: 400; font-style: normal; font-variant: normal; text-decoration: none; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap;">Individuals, organizations, and counties are planting trees and other plants across the state on October 30th, 2020. The goal is to plant 100,000 trees, with 10,000 volunteers, on 1,000 sites in an effort to reduce the effects of climate change and beautify our islands. </span></p>

\n<p dir="ltr" style="line-height: 1.3800000000000001; margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 0pt;"><span style="font-size: 11pt; font-family: Arial; color: #000000; background-color: transparent; font-weight: 400; font-style: normal; font-variant: normal; text-decoration: none; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap;">Rob Weltman, President of the Maui Sierra Club spearheaded the effort earlier this year stating, &ldquo;planting trees is one of the most effective actions ordinary citizens can take to mitigate climate change and it will provide many additional benefits for Maui County.&rdquo; Weltman recognized the urgency of the climate crisis particularly facing island environments such as Hawai&lsquo;i with rising sea levels and extreme weather events.</span></p>

\n<p dir="ltr" style="line-height: 1.3800000000000001; margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 0pt;"><span style="font-size: 11pt; font-family: Arial; color: #000000; background-color: transparent; font-weight: 400; font-style: normal; font-variant: normal; text-decoration: none; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap;">Other organizations saw this initiative as of major importance. Common Ground Collectiveʻs President, Ananda Stone commented, &ldquo;As an island community we are particularly vulnerable to climate change and we&rsquo;re already experiencing effects from it. Since trees offer so many ecosystem services, like protecting watersheds, filtering pollutants, enhancing biodiversity, all while sequestering carbon we should absolutely be planting trees.&rdquo;</span></p>

\n<h3>Please join us, ${Company}, for Lā Hoʻoulu Pae Moku / Retree Hawaii</h3>

\n<p>Individuals, organizations, counties and the State are gearing up to make Hawaii even more beautiful but also more resilient to climate change by planting trees and other plants across the state late in 2020.</p>

\n<p>Plants in general sequester carbon and bind the soil to reduce erosion. Trees provide much-needed shade and cooling in urban and rural areas. Hawaiian native plants stabilize the watershed environments and increase the chances of survival of our endangered forest animals.</p>

\n<p>There will be planting activities across the state on October 30 - at conservation areas, parks, schools, churches, open space areas, hotels and resorts, farms and also at residential complexes such as AOAOs.</p>

\n<p>There are several ways&nbsp;<span style="font-family: -apple-system, BlinkMacSystemFont, 'Segoe UI', Roboto, Oxygen, Ubuntu, Cantarell, 'Open Sans', 'Helvetica Neue', sans-serif;">${Company} can participate:</span></p>

\n<li><span style="font-family: -apple-system, BlinkMacSystemFont, 'Segoe UI', Roboto, Oxygen, Ubuntu, Cantarell, 'Open Sans', 'Helvetica Neue', sans-serif;">Is there a school garden that could use some more plants, or maybe a large lawn that would benefit from shade trees along the edges? In that case, ${Company} can be a planting site for students, teachers and parents. Register the site <a href="https://retree-hawaii.org/planting/sites/add">here</a>.</span></li>

\n<li><span style="font-family: -apple-system, BlinkMacSystemFont, 'Segoe UI', Roboto, Oxygen, Ubuntu, Cantarell, 'Open Sans', 'Helvetica Neue', sans-serif;">If there are no appropriate places for planting, maybe a field trip to help plant at one of the other planting sitea around the island? Find a site <a href="https://retree-hawaii.org/planting/map.html" target="_blank" rel="noopener">here</a>.</span></li>

\n<li><span style="font-family: -apple-system, BlinkMacSystemFont, 'Segoe UI', Roboto, Oxygen, Ubuntu, Cantarell, 'Open Sans', 'Helvetica Neue', sans-serif;">And finally, many students can plant at home and upload pictures <a href="https://retree-hawaii.org/planting/sites/homeplant" target="_blank" rel="noopener">here</a> and the plants will be counted towards the ReTree Hawaii goals.</span></li>

\n<p>It is impossible to predict just what the situation with the coronavirus and related restrictions will be on October 30,&nbsp; but we will do what we can to have a safe event based on the rules in place then. Planting outdoors with significant space between individuals is a safe activity if combined with the common best practices of cleaning tools between use or having participants bring and use their own gloves, and participants bringing their own water. Masks should be worn for briefings and whenever people need to get closer than 6-10 feet. Some sites will have multiple shifts to keep the number of volunteers present low at any given time.</p>
\n<p>Registering or signing up will ask you to create an account by selecting an email address and password. This is a one-time thing to prevent hackers from changing your information.</p>
\n<p>If you have any questions or run into obstacles registering the planting site, please don't hesitate to contact us at the email address below.</p>

\n<p class="MsoNormal"><span style="font-size: 12pt; font-family: tahoma, arial, helvetica, sans-serif;">In this way, the event becomes more than just fun, it acquires educational merit as well.</span></p>

id: \n<h3>Connecting with your volunteers for November planting events, then reporting the results</h3>
\n<p>Thank you again for registering ${Company} at <a href="https://retree-hawaii.org">retree-hawaii.org</a> to participate in the state-wide planting events during November!</p>

\n<p>We hope you have enough volunteers signed up for your event. We have ads running in a number of places to increase the numbers. Volunteers need to hear from you that it is still on for your scheduled date. When you contact them, you can also inform of any changes in the plan since your site was registered, as well as advice on finding the meetup location, what to bring, how long you expect the event will last, etc.</p>

\n<li>You can easily contact your volunteers on your site page at <a href="https://retree-hawaii.org/planting/sites/showallsites" target="_blank" rel="noopener">https://retree-hawaii.org/planting/sites/showallsites</a>. Click on View for your own site. At the bottom of the page, you will see all who have signed up so far. You can select all of them (the very top checkbox) or just some of them and then send email to all of them in one go:<br /><br /><img style="width: 600px;" src="https://retree-hawaii.org/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/send-mail-to-participants.jpg" alt="" /></li>

\n<li>Reach out to your own circle of volunteers and friends and invite them to sign up for your site at&nbsp;<a style="font-family: -apple-system, BlinkMacSystemFont, 'Segoe UI', Roboto, Oxygen, Ubuntu, Cantarell, 'Open Sans', 'Helvetica Neue', sans-serif;" href="https://retree-hawaii.org/planting/sites/showallsites" target="_blank" rel="noopener">https://retree-hawaii.org/planting/sites/showallsites</a><span style="font-family: -apple-system, BlinkMacSystemFont, 'Segoe UI', Roboto, Oxygen, Ubuntu, Cantarell, 'Open Sans', 'Helvetica Neue', sans-serif;">.</span></li>

\n<li>After planting is complete for this round, please use the link at the bottom of your site page to report the number of volunteers and plants:<br /><img style="width: 400px;" src="https://drive.tiny.cloud/1/pm0hwd9ezk1wqe3lvzr86js295g5qcq1vp2pbzgzm0fpbluh/9cc1904a-085e-4c55-8a40-c52189564bc4" alt="" /></li>

\n<p>Please also <a href="https://retree-hawaii.org/planting/sites/showallsites?mineonly=1&amp;edit=1&amp;delete=1">visit your site</a> to update it if there are any changes to your goals for the day or any other updates.</p>
\n<p>If you have any questions or run into obstacles using the tools to send email to your volunteers, please don't hesitate to contact us at the email address below.</p>

id: \n<p>Thank you again for having ${Company} support&nbsp;the state-wide planting day October 30! Hopefully all restrictions on public gatherings due to the pandemic will have been lifted by then. But if not, we will work within the constraints in force to allow the largest possible number of people to plant the most plants feasible at the most sites across the islands on that day. <span style="font-family: -apple-system, BlinkMacSystemFont, 'Segoe UI', Roboto, Oxygen, Ubuntu, Cantarell, 'Open Sans', 'Helvetica Neue', sans-serif;">Planting outdoors with significant space between individuals is a safe activity if combined with the common best practices of cleaning tools between use or having participants bring and use their own gloves, and participants bringing their own water. Masks should be worn for briefings and whenever people need to get closer than 6-10 feet. Some sites will have multiple shifts to keep the number of volunteers present low at any given time.</span></p>

\n<p>The economic hardships and budget constraints have made it difficult for us to cover the costs with grants, so we will be focusing more on donations and other fundraising to be able to pay for plants for schools and other sites that need help.</p>
\n<p>One way is our specially designed t-shirts. Please consider sharing our Facebook post about the new ReTree Hawaii t-shirts:</p>

\n<p><a href="https://www.facebook.com/ReTreeHawaii/posts/212877610171944"><img style="display: block; margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto;" src="https://drive.tiny.cloud/1/pm0hwd9ezk1wqe3lvzr86js295g5qcq1vp2pbzgzm0fpbluh/d31d8086-df08-402f-b2ef-37133669440e" alt="" width="499" height="486" /></a></p>
\n<p>Please also <a href="https://retree-hawaii.org/planting/sites/add">visit the Web site</a> if there are any changes to your goals for the day or any other updates.</p>
\n<p>If you have any questions or run into obstacles updating your info on the website, please don't hesitate to contact us at the email address below.</p>

\n<p><span style="font-size: 18pt;"><span style="font-family: Arial; color: #000000; background-color: transparent; font-weight: bold; font-variant: normal; vertical-align: baseline;">Lā Ho&lsquo;oulu Pae Moku / Retree Hawaii is presenting an online forum September 30 at 5pm - </span></span><span style="font-family: Arial; font-size: 24px; font-weight: bold;">The Climate Crisis and Hawaii </span></p>

\n<p><span style="font-size: 11pt; font-family: Arial; font-weight: bold; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline;"><span style="text-decoration: underline;"><em>September</em></span> 21, 2020</span></p>

\n<p><span style="font-size: 11pt; font-family: Arial; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline;">The coalition <strong>Lā Ho&lsquo;olu Pae Moku / ReTree Hawaii</strong>, which is preparing a state-wide tree planting day October 30 to help mitigate climate change and bring the other benefits of increased forest coverage to the islands, is holding a public forum on September 30 on the climate crisis and Hawaii. Speakers from academia, politics, conservation and youth leadership will discuss the very real threats of climate change to Hawaii, what is being done about them, what needs to be done and what we all can do.</span></p>

\n<p><span style="font-size: 11pt; font-family: Arial; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline;">The climate crisis forum can be watched September 30 at 5pm on Facebook Live at </span><a style="text-decoration-line: none;" href="https://www.facebook.com/ReTreeHawaii/live"><span style="font-size: 11pt; font-family: Arial; color: #1155cc; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; text-decoration-line: underline; text-decoration-skip-ink: none; vertical-align: baseline;">facebook.com/ReTreeHawaii/live</span></a><span style="font-size: 11pt; font-family: Arial; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline;"> and on Youtube Live at </span><a style="text-decoration-line: none;" href="http://bit.ly/climate-youtube"><span style="font-size: 11pt; font-family: Arial; color: #1155cc; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; text-decoration-line: underline; text-decoration-skip-ink: none; vertical-align: baseline;">bit.ly/climate-youtube</span></a><span style="font-size: 11pt; font-family: Arial; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline;">.</span></p>

The Facebook event to share is&nbsp;</span><span style="font-family: Arial; font-size: 14.6667px;"><a href="https://fb.me/e/1KLSnrQJm">https://fb.me/e/1KLSnrQJm</a>.</span></p>

He also serves on the Honolulu Climate Change Commission.</span></p>

After earning an M.S. in Population &amp; Conservation Biology at Texas State and gaining experience with data management and spatial and statistical analysis, Chris joined MFBRP in 2012. Originally from Ohio, Chris has experience working with threatened and endangered forest birds in several regions of the US.</span></p>

\n<p><span style="font-size: 11pt; font-family: Arial; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline;"><span style="border: none; display: inline-block; overflow: hidden; width: 139px; height: 139px;"><img style="margin-left: 0px; margin-top: 0px;" src="https://lh4.googleusercontent.com/UdMrJEz2gDC1DQrb2POf-oTIrkPhGFK6NHoAGvAp3ofTGYfpTAHxIKWeyrHb1CWjhXRShcV05cBw3hqlexUlHCHVhJbviaOBqlu1PFn30Mv992ofWJ2c8tN8Lyla3dNkHXDy-lVt" width="139" height="139" /></span></span></p>

\n<p dir="ltr" style="line-height: 1.3800000000000001; margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 0pt;"><span style="font-size: 11pt; font-family: Arial; color: #000000; background-color: transparent; font-weight: bold; font-style: normal; font-variant: normal; text-decoration: none; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap;">Email:</span><span style="font-size: 11pt; font-family: Arial; color: #000000; background-color: transparent; font-weight: 400; font-style: normal; font-variant: normal; text-decoration: none; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap;"> </span><a style="text-decoration: none;" href="mailto:info@retree-hawaii.org"><span style="font-size: 11pt; font-family: Arial; color: #1155cc; background-color: transparent; font-weight: 400; font-style: normal; font-variant: normal; text-decoration: underline; -webkit-text-decoration-skip: none; text-decoration-skip-ink: none; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap;">info@retree-hawaii.org</span></a></p>

\n<p dir="ltr" style="line-height: 1.3800000000000001; margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 0pt;"><span style="font-size: 11pt; font-family: Arial; color: #000000; background-color: transparent; font-weight: bold; font-style: italic; font-variant: normal; text-decoration: underline; -webkit-text-decoration-skip: none; text-decoration-skip-ink: none; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap;">For Immediate Release</span></p>

\n<p dir="ltr" style="line-height: 1.3800000000000001; text-align: center; margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 0pt;"><span style="font-size: 12pt; font-family: Cambria,serif; color: #000000; background-color: transparent; font-weight: bold; font-style: italic; font-variant: normal; text-decoration: none; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap;">The State and two Counties proclaim October 30, 2020 a &ldquo;Tree Planting Day&rdquo; to help address climate change</span></p>

\n<p dir="ltr" style="line-height: 1.3800000000000001; margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 0pt;"><span style="font-size: 12pt; font-family: Cambria,serif; color: #000000; background-color: transparent; font-weight: 400; font-style: normal; font-variant: normal; text-decoration: none; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap;">In a September 29th announcement, Governor David Ige proclaims October 30th, 2020 as Statewide Tree Planting Day in Hawai&lsquo;i and asks the people of the Aloha State to join him in recognizing the value of trees and plants in combating climate change, asking all residents and visitors to protect the health and environment of our island state.</span></p>

\n<p dir="ltr" style="line-height: 1.3800000000000001; margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 0pt;"><span style="font-size: 12pt; font-family: Cambria,serif; color: #000000; background-color: transparent; font-weight: 400; font-family: Cambria,serif; color: #1155cc; background-color: transparent; font-weight: 400; font-style: normal; font-variant: normal; text-decoration: underline; -webkit-text-decoration-skip: none; text-decoration-skip-ink: none; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap;">Kaua&lsquo;i Mayor Derek Kawakami</span></a><span style="font-size: 12pt; font-family: Cambria,serif; color: #000000; background-color: transparent; font-weight: 400; font-style: normal; font-variant: normal; text-decoration: none; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap;">, </span><a style="text-decoration: none;" href="https://retree-hawaii.org/maui-mayor-mike-victorino-proclaims-october-30-county-wide-tree-planting-day/"><span style="font-size: 12pt; font-family: Cambria,serif; color: #1155cc; background-color: transparent; font-weight: 400; font-style: normal; font-variant: normal; text-decoration: underline; -webkit-text-decoration-skip: none; text-decoration-skip-ink: none; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap;">Maui Mayor Mike Victorino</span></a><span style="font-size: 12pt; font-family: Cambria,serif; color: #000000; background-color: transparent; font-weight: 400; font-style: normal; font-variant: normal; text-decoration: none; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap;"> and the </span><a style="text-decoration: none;" href="https://retree-hawaii.org/maui-county-council-proclaims-october-30-county-tree-planting-day/"><span style="font-size: 12pt; font-family: Cambria,serif; color: #1155cc; background-color: transparent; font-weight: 400; font-style: normal; font-variant: normal; text-decoration: underline; -webkit-text-decoration-skip: none; text-decoration-skip-ink: none; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap;">Maui County Council</span></a><span style="font-size: 12pt; font-family: Cambria,serif; color: #000000; background-color: transparent; font-weight: 400; font-style: normal; font-variant: normal; text-decoration: none; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap;"> making October 30, 2020 a Countywide Tree Planting Day on Kaua&lsquo;i and Maui.</span></p>

\n<p dir="ltr" style="line-height: 1.3800000000000001; margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 0pt;"><span style="font-size: 12pt; font-family: Cambria,serif; color: #000000; background-color: transparent; font-weight: 400; font-style: normal; font-variant: normal; text-decoration: none; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap;">Maui County Council member, Kelly King says &ldquo;it's one of the most important things weʻve been doing for climate change and itʻs important that it gets recognized.&rdquo;</span></p>

\n<p dir="ltr" style="line-height: 1.3800000000000001; margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 0pt;"><span style="font-size: 12pt; font-family: Cambria,serif; color: #000000; background-color: transparent; font-weight: 400; font-style: normal; font-variant: normal; text-decoration: none; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap;">The Statewide and County-wide Tree Planting event on October 30th, 2020 is organized by </span><span style="font-size: 12pt; font-family: Cambria,serif; color: #000000; background-color: transparent; font-weight: bold; font-style: normal; font-variant: normal; text-decoration: none; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap;">Lā Ho&lsquo;olu Pae Moku / ReTree Hawaii</span><span style="font-size: 12pt; font-family: Cambria,serif; color: #000000; background-color: transparent; font-weight: 400; font-style: normal; font-variant: normal; text-decoration: none; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap;">, a coalition of climate, environmental and conservation organizations together with schools, government agencies and community groups. Information about the event and signup to participate in planting are available at </span><a style="text-decoration: none;" href="https://retree-hawaii.org"><span style="font-size: 12pt; font-family: Cambria,serif; color: #1155cc; background-color: transparent; font-weight: 400; font-style: normal; font-variant: normal; text-decoration: underline; -webkit-text-decoration-skip: none; text-decoration-skip-ink: none; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap;">retree-hawaii.org</span></a><span style="font-size: 12pt; font-family: Cambria,serif; color: #000000; background-color: transparent; font-weight: 400; font-style: normal; font-variant: normal; text-decoration: none; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap;">.</span></p>

font-family: Arial; color: #000000; background-color: transparent; font-weight: 400; font-style: normal; font-variant: normal; text-decoration: none; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap;"><span class="Apple-tab-span" style="white-space: pre;"> </span></span><span style="font-size: 11pt; font-family: Arial; color: #000000; background-color: transparent; font-weight: 400; font-style: normal; font-variant: normal; text-decoration: none; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap;"> </span><span style="font-size: 11pt; font-family: Arial; color: #000000; background-color: transparent; font-weight: 400; font-style: normal; font-variant: normal; text-decoration: none; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap;"><span class="Apple-tab-span" style="white-space: pre;"> </span></span><span style="font-size: 11pt; font-family: Arial; color: #000000; background-color: transparent; font-weight: 400; font-style: normal; font-variant: normal; text-decoration: none; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap;"> </span><span style="font-size: 11pt; font-family: Arial; color: #000000; background-color: transparent; font-weight: 400; font-style: normal; font-variant: normal; text-decoration: none; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap;"><span class="Apple-tab-span" style="white-space: pre;"> </span></span><span style="font-size: 11pt; font-family: Arial; color: #000000; background-color: transparent; font-weight: 400; font-style: normal; font-variant: normal; text-decoration: none; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap;"><span class="Apple-tab-span" style="white-space: pre;"> </span></span></p>

\n<p dir="ltr" style="line-height: 1.3800000000000001; margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 0pt;"><span style="font-size: 13pt; font-family: Cambria,serif; color: #000000; background-color: transparent; font-weight: bold; font-style: normal; font-variant: normal; text-decoration: none; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap;">WHEREAS, </span><span style="font-size: 13pt; font-family: Cambria,serif; color: #000000; background-color: transparent; font-weight: 400; font-style: normal; font-variant: normal; text-decoration: none; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap;">greenhouse gases from human activities worldwide are the most significant driver of climate change since the mid-20</span><span style="font-size: 9pt; font-family: Cambria,serif; color: #000000; background-color: transparent; font-weight: 400; font-style: normal; font-variant: normal; text-decoration: none; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap;">th </span><span style="font-size: 13pt; font-family: Cambria,serif; color: #000000; background-color: transparent; font-weight: 400; font-style: normal; font-variant: normal; text-decoration: none; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap;">century; and</span></p>

\n<p dir="ltr" style="line-height: 1.3800000000000001; margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 0pt;"><span style="font-size: 13pt; font-family: Cambria,serif; color: #000000; background-color: transparent; font-weight: bold; font-style: normal; font-variant: normal; text-decoration: none; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap;">WHEREAS, </span><span style="font-size: 13pt; font-family: Cambria,serif; color: #000000; background-color: transparent; font-weight: 400; font-style: normal; font-variant: normal; text-decoration: none; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap;">climate change is real and we&rsquo;re seeing its impacts right now in our island state in rising sea levels, warmer air and ocean temperatures, coral bleaching, an increase in ocean acidity, coastline erosion and extreme weather events, which are all threats to the health and environment of the Hawaiian islands; and</span></p>

\n<p dir="ltr" style="line-height: 1.3800000000000001; margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 0pt;"><span style="font-size: 13pt; font-family: Cambria,serif; color: #000000; background-color: transparent; font-weight: bold; font-style: normal; font-variant: normal; text-decoration: none; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap;">WHEREAS, </span><span style="font-size: 13pt; font-family: Cambria,serif; color: #000000; background-color: transparent; font-weight: 400; font-style: normal; font-variant: normal; text-decoration: none; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap;">sea level rise is already having an impact on beaches, roadways and homes near the shoreline on every island; and</span></p>

\n<p dir="ltr" style="line-height: 1.3800000000000001; margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 0pt;"><span style="font-size: 13pt; font-family: Cambria,serif; color: #000000; background-color: transparent; font-weight: bold; font-style: normal; font-variant: normal; text-decoration: none; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap;">WHEREAS, </span><span style="font-size: 13pt; font-family: Cambria,serif; color: #000000; background-color: transparent; font-weight: 400; font-style: normal; font-variant: normal; text-decoration: none; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap;">the statewide tree planting initiative is a response to the growing threat of climate change to our counties and our state; and</span></p>

\n<p dir="ltr" style="line-height: 1.3800000000000001; margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 0pt;"><span style="font-size: 13pt; font-family: Cambria,serif; color: #000000; background-color: transparent; font-weight: bold; font-style: normal; font-variant: normal; text-decoration: none; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap;">WHEREAS, </span><span style="font-size: 13pt; font-family: Cambria,serif; color: #000000; background-color: transparent; font-weight: 400; font-style: normal; font-variant: normal; text-decoration: none; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap;">trees help fight climate change. </span><span style="font-size: 13.999999999999998pt; font-family: Cambria,serif; color: #000000; background-color: transparent; font-weight: 400; font-style: normal; font-variant: normal; text-decoration: none; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap;">As trees grow, they remove carbon dioxide from the air, storing carbon in the trees and soil, and release oxygen into the atmosphere; and</span></p>

\n<p dir="ltr" style="line-height: 1.3800000000000001; margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 0pt;"><span style="font-size: 13pt; font-family: Cambria,serif; color: #000000; background-color: transparent; font-weight: bold; font-style: normal; font-variant: normal; text-decoration: none; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap;">WHEREAS, </span><span style="font-size: 13pt; font-family: Cambria,serif; color: #000000; background-color: transparent; font-weight: 400; font-style: normal; font-variant: normal; text-decoration: none; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap;">trees provide many benefits to us, everyday. They offer cooling shade, attract birds and wildlife, purify our air, prevent soil erosion, clean our water, and </span><span style="font-size: 13pt; font-family: Cambria,serif; color: #000000; background-color: transparent; font-weight: 400; font-style: normal; font-variant: normal; text-decoration: none; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap;"><span class="Apple-tab-span" style="white-space: pre;"> </span></span><span style="font-size: 13pt; font-family: Cambria,serif; color: #000000; background-color: transparent; font-weight: 400; font-style: normal; font-variant: normal; text-decoration: none; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap;"> add beauty to our homes and communities; and</span></p>

\n<p dir="ltr" style="line-height: 1.3800000000000001; margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 0pt;"><span style="font-size: 13pt; font-family: Cambria,serif; color: #000000; background-color: transparent; font-weight: bold; font-style: normal; font-variant: normal; text-decoration: none; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap;">WHEREAS, </span><span style="font-size: 13pt; font-family: Cambria,serif; color: #000000; background-color: transparent; font-weight: 400; font-style: normal; font-variant: normal; text-decoration: none; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap;">on October 30</span><span style="font-size: 9pt; font-family: Cambria,serif; color: #000000; background-color: transparent; font-weight: 400; font-style: normal; font-variant: normal; text-decoration: none; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap;">th</span><span style="font-size: 13pt; font-family: Cambria,serif; color: #000000; background-color: transparent; font-weight: 400; font-style: normal; font-variant: normal; text-decoration: none; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap;">, with the goal to plant 100,000 trees, with 10,000 volunteers, on 1,000 sites across the state, public, private and non-profit organizations will plant trees and other plants that sequester carbon from the atmosphere and beautify our islands;</span></p>

\n<p dir="ltr" style="line-height: 1.3800000000000001; margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 0pt;"><span style="font-size: 13pt; font-family: Cambria,serif; color: #000000; background-color: transparent; font-weight: bold; font-style: normal; font-variant: normal; text-decoration: none; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap;">THEREFORE I, DAVID Y. IGE, Governor </span><span style="font-size: 13pt; font-family: Cambria,serif; color: #000000; background-color: transparent; font-weight: 400; font-style: normal; font-variant: normal; text-decoration: none; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap;">of the </span><span style="font-size: 13pt; font-family: Cambria,serif; color: #000000; background-color: transparent; font-weight: bold; font-style: normal; font-variant: normal; text-decoration: none; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap;">State of Hawai&lsquo;i, </span><span style="font-size: 13pt; font-family: Cambria,serif; color: #000000; background-color: transparent; font-weight: 400; font-style: normal; font-variant: normal; text-decoration: none; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap;">do hereby proclaim October 30, 2020 as&nbsp;</span></p>

\n<p dir="ltr" style="line-height: 1.3800000000000001; margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 0pt;"><span style="font-size: 11pt; font-family: Arial; color: #000000; background-color: transparent; font-weight: bold; font-style: normal; font-variant: normal; text-decoration: none; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap;">Phone:</span><span style="font-size: 11pt; font-family: Arial; color: #000000; background-color: transparent; font-weight: 400; font-style: normal; font-variant: normal; text-decoration: none; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap;"> (808) 354-0490</span></p>

\n<p dir="ltr" style="line-height: 1.3800000000000001; margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 0pt;"><span style="font-size: 11pt; font-family: Arial; color: #000000; background-color: transparent; font-weight: bold; font-style: normal; font-variant: normal; text-decoration: none; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap;">Date:</span><span style="font-size: 11pt; font-family: Arial; color: #000000; background-color: transparent; font-weight: 400; font-style: normal; font-variant: normal; text-decoration: none; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap;"> October 31,2020</span></p>

\n<p dir="ltr" style="line-height: 1.3800000000000001; margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 0pt;"><span style="font-size: 11pt; font-family: Arial; color: #000000; background-color: transparent; font-weight: bold; font-style: italic; font-variant: normal; text-decoration: underline; -webkit-text-decoration-skip: none; text-decoration-skip-ink: none; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap;">For Immediate Release</span></p>

\n<p dir="ltr" style="line-height: 1.3800000000000001; text-align: center; margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 0pt;"><span style="font-size: 12pt; font-family: Cambria,serif; color: #000000; background-color: transparent; font-weight: bold; font-style: italic; font-variant: normal; text-decoration: none; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap;">Volunteers planted trees and other plants on six Hawaiian islands yesterday, October 30, to help address climate change</span></p>

\n<p dir="ltr" style="line-height: 1.3800000000000001; margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 0pt;"><span style="font-size: 12pt; font-family: Cambria,serif; color: #000000; background-color: transparent; font-weight: 400; font-style: normal; font-variant: normal; text-decoration: none; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap;">Volunteers and staff joined at public and private properties on Moloka&lsquo;i, Lāna&lsquo;i, Maui, Hawai&lsquo;i, Kaua&lsquo;i and O&lsquo;ahu yesterday, October 30, to plant trees and other plants. Hundreds of volunteers planted thousands of plants at dozens of sites across the state. Trees and other plants help mitigate climate change by absorbing greenhouse gases and binding carbon. They also bind the soil, prevent erosion and runoff, capture moisture from the air, provide shade and cooling, and beautify the islands.</span></p>

\n<p dir="ltr" style="line-height: 1.3800000000000001; margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 0pt;"><span style="font-size: 12pt; font-family: Cambria,serif; color: #000000; background-color: transparent; font-weight: 400; font-style: normal; font-variant: normal; text-decoration: none; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap;">Governor David Ige made an announcement on September 29 proclaiming October 30th, 2020 as Statewide Tree Planting Day in Hawai&lsquo;i and asking the people of the Aloha State to join him in recognizing the value of trees and plants in combating climate change, asking all residents and visitors to protect the health and environment of our island state.</span></p>

\n<p dir="ltr" style="line-height: 1.3800000000000001; margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 0pt;"><strong style="font-weight: normal; font-family: Cambria, serif; font-size: 16px; white-space: pre-wrap;">The vast majority of the plants were native Hawaiian trees.&nbsp;</strong><span style="font-family: Cambria, serif; font-size: 16px; white-space: pre-wrap;"> Native Hawaiian plants provide sustenance for native Hawaiian animals and help secure our vital watersheds.</span></p>

\n<p dir="ltr" style="line-height: 1.3800000000000001; margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 0pt;"><span style="font-size: 12pt; font-family: Cambria,serif; color: #000000; background-color: transparent; font-weight: 400; font-style: normal; font-variant: normal; text-decoration: none; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap;">Maui County Council member, Kelly King says &ldquo;it's one of the most important things weʻve been doing for climate change and itʻs important that it gets recognized.&rdquo;</span></p>

\n<p dir="ltr" style="line-height: 1.3800000000000001; margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 0pt;"><span style="font-size: 12pt; font-family: Cambria,serif; color: #000000; background-color: transparent; font-weight: 400; font-style: normal; font-variant: normal; text-decoration: none; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap;">ReTree Hawaii Chief Organizer Rob Weltman adds "yesterday was a big step forward in bringing Hawai&lsquo;i together to take practical steps to reduce the impacts of the climate crisis, while continuing to work towards eliminating the cause - fossil fuel production and combustion. Let's build on this success and all do what we can to move to renewable energy sources for power and transportation and protect our fragile island environment.".</span></p>

\n<p dir="ltr" style="line-height: 1.3800000000000001; margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 0pt;"><span style="font-size: 12pt; font-family: Cambria,serif; color: #000000; background-color: transparent; font-weight: 400; font-style: normal; font-variant: normal; text-decoration: none; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap;">The Statewide Tree Planting event on October 30th, 2020 was organized by </span><span style="font-size: 12pt; font-family: Cambria,serif; color: #000000; background-color: transparent; font-weight: bold; font-style: normal; font-variant: normal; text-decoration: none; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap;">Lā Ho&lsquo;olu Pae Moku / ReTree Hawaii</span><span style="font-size: 12pt; font-family: Cambria,serif; color: #000000; background-color: transparent; font-weight: 400; font-style: normal; font-variant: normal; text-decoration: none; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap;">, a coalition of climate, environmental and conservation organizations together with schools, government agencies and community groups. Information about the event is available at </span><a style="text-decoration: none;" href="https://retree-hawaii.org"><span style="font-size: 12pt; font-family: Cambria,serif; color: #1155cc; background-color: transparent; font-weight: 400; font-style: normal; font-variant: normal; text-decoration: underline; -webkit-text-decoration-skip: none; text-decoration-skip-ink: none; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap;">retree-hawaii.org</span></a><span style="font-size: 12pt; font-family: Cambria,serif; color: #000000; background-color: transparent; font-weight: 400; font-style: normal; font-variant: normal; text-decoration: none; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap;">.</span></p>

text: <p style="width: 100%; text-align: center; margin: auto;"><img style="width: 100%;" src="https://retree-hawaii.org/wp-content/uploads/2021/02/retree-banner.png" width="800" /></p>

id: \n<p>&nbsp; The 51st anniversary of the first Earth Day is coming up on Thursday next week, April 22. Unlike in all the previous years (except for last year), there won't be millions of people in the streets and parks this time. In most places, people will be hunkering down indoors to avoid spreading the coronavirus and to help end the pandemic.</p>

\n<p>&nbsp;&nbsp;<a href="https://retree-hawaii.org" target="_blank" rel="noopener">Lā Ho&lsquo;olu Pae Moku / ReTree Hawaii</a> will be trying to reach as many people as it can across Hawaii with a program at 6pm about the climate crisis, the value of planting trees to capture carbon and mitigate the crisis, tips for rapidly propagating native Hawaiian plants and about a bold plan to create a native wildlife corridor around the upper slopes of Haleakalā - Mauna Lea. There will also be entertainment by gifted Maui composer and musician Anthony Pfluke, whose orginal music often is inspired by aloha &lsquo;āina.</p>

\n<p>&nbsp; To get this shared message out, we would love to have you "like" our&nbsp;<a href="https://www.facebook.com/RetreeHawaii" target="_blank" rel="noopener">Facebook page</a> and share our Earth Day event - <a title="Earth Day 2021" href="https://www.facebook.com/events/880252862821791" target="_blank" rel="noopener">https://www.facebook.com/events/880252862821791</a>. The promotional video trailer is here: <a href="https://youtu.be/yamApxI210Y" target="_blank" rel="noopener">https://youtu.be/yamApxI210Y</a>. You can also co-host the live sending on Facebook if you like. Let us know, if so, and we'll invite your Facebook page to co-host. Combining our networks will increase the number of people we can lift out of the doldrums of isolation with a positive message about change we can all contribute to.</p>

\n<p>&nbsp; Note that a Facebook account is not required to watch the program at <a href="https://facebook.com/ReTreeHawaii/live" target="_blank" rel="noopener">https://facebook.com/ReTreeHawaii/live</a>.</p>

id: \n<p dir="ltr" style="line-height: 1.2; margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 0pt;"><span style="font-size: 14pt;"><span style="font-family: Cambria, serif; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap;">Individuals, organizations, counties and the State are gearing up to make Hawaii even more beautiful but also more resilient to climate change by planting trees and other plants across the state in November. The Honolulu Department of Parks and Recreation </span><a style="text-decoration-line: none;" href="http://www.honolulu.gov/rep/site/dpr/duf_docs/Urban_Tree_Plan_Final_Draft.pdf"><span style="font-family: Cambria, serif; color: #0000ff; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; text-decoration-line: underline; text-decoration-skip-ink: none; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap;">lists</span></a><span style="font-family: Cambria, serif; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap;"> many advantages of planting trees in an urban environment:</span></span></p>

\n<li dir="ltr" style="list-style-type: disc; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Noto Sans Symbols', sans-serif; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline;" aria-level="1">

\n<li dir="ltr" style="list-style-type: disc; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Noto Sans Symbols', sans-serif; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline;" aria-level="1">

\n<p dir="ltr" style="line-height: 1.2; margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 0pt;" role="presentation"><span style="font-size: 14pt; font-family: Cambria, serif; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap;">Improved air quality</span></p>

\n<li dir="ltr" style="list-style-type: disc; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Noto Sans Symbols', sans-serif; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline;" aria-level="1">

\n<p dir="ltr" style="line-height: 1.2; margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 0pt;" role="presentation"><span style="font-size: 14pt; font-family: Cambria, serif; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap;">Stabilized temperatures</span></p>

\n<li dir="ltr" style="list-style-type: disc; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Noto Sans Symbols', sans-serif; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline;" aria-level="1">

\n<p dir="ltr" style="line-height: 1.2; margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 0pt;" role="presentation"><span style="font-size: 14pt; font-family: Cambria, serif; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap;">Wildlife habitat</span></p>

\n<li dir="ltr" style="list-style-type: disc; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Noto Sans Symbols', sans-serif; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline;" aria-level="1">

\n<li dir="ltr" style="list-style-type: disc; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Noto Sans Symbols', sans-serif; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline;" aria-level="1">

\n<li dir="ltr" style="list-style-type: disc; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Noto Sans Symbols', sans-serif; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline;" aria-level="1">

\n<li dir="ltr" style="list-style-type: disc; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Noto Sans Symbols', sans-serif; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline;" aria-level="1">

\n<li dir="ltr" style="list-style-type: disc; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Noto Sans Symbols', sans-serif; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline;" aria-level="1">

\n<li dir="ltr" style="list-style-type: disc; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Noto Sans Symbols', sans-serif; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline;" aria-level="1">

\n<li dir="ltr" style="list-style-type: disc; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Noto Sans Symbols', sans-serif; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline;" aria-level="1">

\n<p dir="ltr" style="line-height: 1.2; margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 0pt;" role="presentation"><span style="font-size: 14pt; font-family: Cambria, serif; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap;">Energy savings</span></p>

\n<li dir="ltr" style="list-style-type: disc; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Noto Sans Symbols', sans-serif; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline;" aria-level="1">

\n<p dir="ltr" style="line-height: 1.2; margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 0pt;" role="presentation"><span style="font-size: 14pt; font-family: Cambria, serif; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap;">Stormwater management</span></p>

\n<li dir="ltr" style="list-style-type: disc; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Noto Sans Symbols', sans-serif; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline;" aria-level="1">

\n<p dir="ltr" style="line-height: 1.2; margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 0pt;" role="presentation"><span style="font-size: 14pt; font-family: Cambria, serif; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap;">Green infrastructure</span></p>

\n<p dir="ltr" style="line-height: 1.2; margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 0pt;"><span style="font-size: 14pt; font-family: Cambria, serif; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap;"><br>Trees and other plants also pull carbon dioxide out of the air and keep the carbon sequestered in the ground, a valuable step in slowing climate change.</span></p>

\n<p dir="ltr" style="line-height: 1.2; margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 0pt;"><span style="font-size: 14pt; font-family: Cambria, serif; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap;"><br>Hawaiian native plants stabilize the watershed environments and increase the chances of survival of our endangered forest animals.</span></p>

\n<p dir="ltr" style="line-height: 1.2; margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 0pt;"><span style="font-size: 14pt; font-family: Cambria, serif; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap;"><br>There will be planting activities across the state throughout November this year - at conservation areas, parks, schools, churches, open space areas, hotels and resorts, golf courses and other businesses.</span></p>

\n<p><span style="font-family: Cambria, serif; font-size: 14pt; white-space: pre-wrap;">Would ${company} like to participate in these planting activities in November? Is there an area where plants can be put in the ground to beautify the local environment while helping Hawai&lsquo;i and the world resist climate change? The planting event can be open to the public, open to hotel guests or restricted to hotel staff - all depending on what works best for you.</span></p>

\n<p dir="ltr" style="line-height: 1.2; margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 0pt;"><span style="font-size: 14pt; font-family: Cambria, serif; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap;">Perhaps you would like to develop or expand a native plant environment where guests can learn about and appreciate the history of our islands and how the Polynesians flourished with the plants they found here and the ones they brought with them. Or perhaps this would be an opportunity to expand a tropical plant area.</span></p>

\n<p dir="ltr" style="line-height: 1.2; margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 0pt;"><span style="font-size: 14pt; font-family: Cambria, serif; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap;"><br>If there are no options for planting at your location, perhaps you could offer transportation of guests and/or employees to a different site where planting will be happening.</span></p>

\n<h2 dir="ltr" style="line-height: 1.2; margin-top: 10pt; margin-bottom: 0pt;"><span style="font-size: 14pt; font-family: Calibri, sans-serif; color: #4f81bd; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap;">What we can help with:</span></h2>

\n<li dir="ltr" style="list-style-type: disc; font-size: 12pt; font-family: 'Noto Sans Symbols', sans-serif; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline;" aria-level="1">

\n<li dir="ltr" style="list-style-type: disc; font-size: 12pt; font-family: 'Noto Sans Symbols', sans-serif; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline;" aria-level="1">

\n<h2 dir="ltr" style="line-height: 1.2; margin-top: 10pt; margin-bottom: 0pt;"><span style="font-size: 14pt; font-family: Calibri, sans-serif; color: #4f81bd; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap;">What happens next:</span></h2>

\n<li dir="ltr" style="list-style-type: disc; font-size: 12pt; font-family: 'Noto Sans Symbols', sans-serif; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline;" aria-level="1">

\n<p dir="ltr" style="line-height: 1.2; margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 0pt;" role="presentation"><span style="font-size: 14pt;"><span style="font-family: Cambria, serif; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap;">Our website </span><a style="text-decoration-line: none;" href="https://retree-hawaii.org/planting"><span style="font-family: Cambria, serif; color: #1155cc; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; text-decoration-line: underline; text-decoration-skip-ink: none; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap;">https://retree-hawaii.org/planting</span></a><span style="font-family: Cambria, serif; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap;"> is open for you to register your planting location. You can update the information there at any time after that. The first time there, it will ask you to create a login.</span></span></p>

\n<li dir="ltr" style="list-style-type: disc; font-size: 12pt; font-family: 'Noto Sans Symbols', sans-serif; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline;" aria-level="1">

\n<li dir="ltr" style="list-style-type: disc; font-size: 12pt; font-family: 'Noto Sans Symbols', sans-serif; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline;" aria-level="1">

\n<p dir="ltr" style="line-height: 1.2; margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 0pt;" role="presentation"><span style="font-size: 14pt; font-family: Cambria, serif; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap;">You will be able to see the names and contact information of all who have signed up to plant at your site at all times and there is a very easy way to send email to all of them at once.&nbsp;</span></p>

\n<li dir="ltr" style="list-style-type: disc; font-size: 12pt; font-family: 'Noto Sans Symbols', sans-serif; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline;" aria-level="1">

\n<p dir="ltr" style="line-height: 1.2; margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 0pt;" role="presentation"><span style="font-size: 14pt; font-family: Cambria, serif; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap;">Throughout the year we will be using every channel we can think of to educate Hawaii about the threat of climate change, what needs to be done to address it and how every single person can play a part in the solution.</span></p>

\n<h2 dir="ltr" style="line-height: 1.2; margin-top: 10pt; margin-bottom: 0pt;"><span style="font-size: 14pt; font-family: Calibri, sans-serif; color: #4f81bd; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap;">On the planting day:</span></h2>

\n<li dir="ltr" style="list-style-type: disc; font-size: 12pt; font-family: 'Noto Sans Symbols', sans-serif; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline;" aria-level="1">

\n<li dir="ltr" style="list-style-type: disc; font-size: 12pt; font-family: 'Noto Sans Symbols', sans-serif; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline;" aria-level="1">

\n<li dir="ltr" style="list-style-type: disc; font-size: 12pt; font-family: 'Noto Sans Symbols', sans-serif; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline;" aria-level="1">

\n<li dir="ltr" style="list-style-type: disc; font-size: 12pt; font-family: 'Noto Sans Symbols', sans-serif; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline;" aria-level="1">

\n<p dir="ltr" style="line-height: 1.2; margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 0pt;" role="presentation"><span style="font-size: 14pt; font-family: Cambria, serif; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap;">After planting is complete, update the Web site with the actual number of volunteers and plants, and upload the pictures</span></p>

\n<h2 dir="ltr" style="line-height: 1.2; margin-top: 10pt; margin-bottom: 0pt;"><span style="font-size: 14pt; font-family: Calibri, sans-serif; color: #4f81bd; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap;">And then:</span></h2>

\n<li dir="ltr" style="list-style-type: disc; font-size: 12pt; font-family: 'Noto Sans Symbols', sans-serif; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline;" aria-level="1">

\n<li dir="ltr" style="list-style-type: disc; font-size: 12pt; font-family: 'Noto Sans Symbols', sans-serif; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline;" aria-level="1">

\n<p dir="ltr" style="line-height: 1.2; margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 0pt;"><span style="font-size: 14pt;"><a style="text-decoration-line: none;" href="mailto:hotels@retree-hawaii.org"><span style="font-family: Cambria, serif; color: #1155cc; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; text-decoration-line: underline; text-decoration-skip-ink: none; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap;">hotels@retree-hawaii.org</span></a></span></p>

\n<h3>Please join us, ${company}, for Lā Hoʻoulu Pae Moku / Retree Hawaii</h3>

\n<p>Individuals, organizations, counties and the State are gearing up to make Hawai&lsquo;i even more beautiful but also more resilient to climate change by planting trees and other plants across the state throughout the month of November 2021.</p>
\n<p>As a farm, ${company} is a key part of the solution to the climate crisis facing our islands thanks to the many plants absorbing carbon dioxide, emitting oxygen and sequestering carbon.</p>

\n<p>There will be planting activities across the state throughout November this year - at conservation areas, parks, schools, churches, open space areas, hotels and resorts, farms and many others.</p>
\n<p>Volunteer activities can be directed towards clearing and other ground preparation, wind barriers as well as getting additional plants in the ground.</p>

\n<p><img style="display: block; margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto;" src="https://retree-hawaii.org/planting/pictures/EkoluMCL@hawaii.rr.com/2020-10-30/IMG_3194.jpg" alt="" width="800" height="600" /></p>

\n<p>Now is the time for <span style="font-family: -apple-system, BlinkMacSystemFont, 'Segoe UI', Roboto, Oxygen, Ubuntu, Cantarell, 'Open Sans', 'Helvetica Neue', sans-serif;">${company} to register one or more dates for planting activities in November if you haven't already done so. </span><span style="font-family: -apple-system, BlinkMacSystemFont, 'Segoe UI', Roboto, Oxygen, Ubuntu, Cantarell, 'Open Sans', 'Helvetica Neue', sans-serif;">Register the site</span><span style="font-family: -apple-system, BlinkMacSystemFont, 'Segoe UI', Roboto, Oxygen, Ubuntu, Cantarell, 'Open Sans', 'Helvetica Neue', sans-serif;">&nbsp;</span><a style="font-family: -apple-system, BlinkMacSystemFont, 'Segoe UI', Roboto, Oxygen, Ubuntu, Cantarell, 'Open Sans', 'Helvetica Neue', sans-serif;" href="https://retree-hawaii.org/planting/sites/add">here</a><span style="font-family: -apple-system, BlinkMacSystemFont, 'Segoe UI', Roboto, Oxygen, Ubuntu, Cantarell, 'Open Sans', 'Helvetica Neue', sans-serif;">.</span></p>

\n<p><span style="font-family: -apple-system, BlinkMacSystemFont, 'Segoe UI', Roboto, Oxygen, Ubuntu, Cantarell, 'Open Sans', 'Helvetica Neue', sans-serif;">Last year many sites were closed to outside volunteers due to the pandemic so only staff and a small circle of key volunteers were able to participate in the event.&nbsp;</span><span style="font-family: -apple-system, BlinkMacSystemFont, 'Segoe UI', Roboto, Oxygen, Ubuntu, Cantarell, 'Open Sans', 'Helvetica Neue', sans-serif;">If there is a risk for that happening again this year with your organization, you can still register</span><span style="font-family: -apple-system, BlinkMacSystemFont, 'Segoe UI', Roboto, Oxygen, Ubuntu, Cantarell, 'Open Sans', 'Helvetica Neue', sans-serif;">&nbsp;</span><a style="font-family: -apple-system, BlinkMacSystemFont, 'Segoe UI', Roboto, Oxygen, Ubuntu, Cantarell, 'Open Sans', 'Helvetica Neue', sans-serif;" href="https://retree-hawaii.org/planting/sites/add">here</a><span style="font-family: -apple-system, BlinkMacSystemFont, 'Segoe UI', Roboto, Oxygen, Ubuntu, Cantarell, 'Open Sans', 'Helvetica Neue', sans-serif;">. Just set the maximum number of participants to the number of expected staff and then sign up a work group of the same size for your site <a href="https://retree-hawaii.org/planting/sites/showallsites">here</a>. If conditions later allow for outside volunteers as well, you can go back to the <a href="https://retree-hawaii.org/planting/sites/add">site registration</a> and increase the maximum number of participants. You can update the site registration as often as needed.</span></p>
\n<p>Registering or signing up will ask you to create an account by selecting an email address and password. This is a one-time thing to prevent hackers from changing your information.</p>
\n<p>If you have any questions or run into obstacles registering or signing up, please don't hesitate to contact us at the email address below.</p>

\n

Please join us, ${company}, for Lā Hoʻoulu Pae Moku / Retree Hawaii

\n

Individuals, organizations, counties and the State are gearing up to make Hawai‘i even more beautiful but also more resilient to climate change by planting trees and other plants across the state in November.

\n

Read more about ReTree Hawaii and the many supporting organizations at https://retree-hawaii.org.

\n

As an organization dedicated to conservation, ${company} is a key part of the solution to the climate crisis facing our islands.

\n

There will be planting activities across the state throughout November this year - at conservation areas, parks, schools, churches, open space areas, hotels and resorts, farms and many others.
\n

\n

Now is the time for ${company} to register one or more dates for planting activities in November if you haven't already done so. Register the site here.

\n

Many organizations already have planting events of their own in the works. If yours does, you can get some extra publicity for it by registering it with ReTree Hawaii.

\n

If you would like to participate in the campaign but limit the participants to employees and family members, you can still register here. Just set the maximum number of participants to the number of expected staff and then sign up a work group of the same size for your site here. If conditions later allow for outside volunteers as well, you can go back to the site registration and increase the maximum number of participants. You can update the site registration as often as needed.

\n

There is a link at the bottom of the site registration form to request assistance with plants, if necessary.

\n

Registering or signing up will ask you to create an account by selecting an email address and password. This is a one-time thing to prevent hackers from changing your information.

\n

If you have any questions or run into obstacles registering or signing up, please don't hesitate to contact us at the email address below.

id: \n<p id="docs-internal-guid-45f49f46-7fff-cd80-3e6e-562b77c4b502" dir="ltr" style="line-height: 1.3800000000000001; margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 0pt;"><span style="font-size: 11pt; font-family: Arial; color: #000000; background-color: transparent; font-weight: bold; font-style: normal; font-variant: normal; text-decoration: none; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap;">Contact: </span><span style="font-size: 11pt; font-family: Arial; color: #000000; background-color: transparent; font-weight: 400; font-style: normal; font-variant: normal; text-decoration: none; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap;">Rob Weltman, ReTree Hawaii chief organizer</span></p>

\n<p dir="ltr" style="line-height: 1.3800000000000001; margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 0pt;"><span style="font-size: 11pt; font-family: Arial; color: #000000; background-color: transparent; font-weight: bold; font-style: normal; font-variant: normal; text-decoration: none; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap;">Phone:</span><span style="font-size: 11pt; font-family: Arial; color: #000000; background-color: transparent; font-weight: 400; font-style: normal; font-variant: normal; text-decoration: none; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap;"> (808) 354-0490</span></p>

\n<p dir="ltr" style="line-height: 1.3800000000000001; margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 0pt;"><span style="font-size: 11pt; font-family: Arial; color: #000000; background-color: transparent; font-weight: bold; font-style: normal; font-variant: normal; text-decoration: none; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap;">Email:</span><span style="font-size: 11pt; font-family: Arial; color: #000000; background-color: transparent; font-weight: 400; font-style: normal; font-variant: normal; text-decoration: none; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap;"> info@retree-hawaii.org</span></p>

\n<p dir="ltr" style="line-height: 1.3800000000000001; margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 0pt;"><span style="font-size: 11pt; font-family: Arial; color: #000000; background-color: transparent; font-weight: bold; font-style: italic; font-variant: normal; text-decoration: underline; -webkit-text-decoration-skip: none; text-decoration-skip-ink: none; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap;">For Immediate Release</span></p>

\n<p dir="ltr" style="line-height: 1.3800000000000001; margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 0pt;"><span style="font-size: 11pt; font-family: Arial; color: #000000; background-color: transparent; font-weight: bold; font-style: normal; font-variant: normal; text-decoration: none; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap;">Lā Ho&lsquo;oulu Paemoku / Retree Hawaii announces a second statewide tree planting initiative in November to make Hawai&lsquo;i more resilient to climate change.</span></p>

\n<p dir="ltr" style="line-height: 1.3800000000000001; margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 0pt;"><span style="font-size: 11pt; font-family: Arial; color: #000000; background-color: transparent; font-weight: bold; font-style: normal; font-variant: normal; text-decoration: none; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap;">October 13, 2021</span></p>

\n<p dir="ltr" style="line-height: 1.3800000000000001; margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 0pt;"><span style="font-size: 11pt; font-family: Arial; color: #000000; background-color: transparent; font-weight: 400; font-style: normal; font-variant: normal; text-decoration: none; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap;">Individuals, organizations, and counties are planting trees and other plants across the state throughout the month of November 2021. Every plant contributes to reducing the effects of climate change and beautifying our islands. </span></p>

\n<p dir="ltr" style="line-height: 1.3800000000000001; margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 0pt;"><span style="font-size: 11pt; font-family: Arial; color: #000000; background-color: transparent; font-weight: 400; font-style: normal; font-variant: normal; text-decoration: none; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap;">This year's campaign follows on last year's successful planting event on October 30, when people came together on six of the seven populated Hawaiian islands to increase the number of trees and other plants binding carbon and releasing oxygen in the state. Rob Weltman, chief organizer of ReTree Hawaii, spearheaded the campaign last year stating, &ldquo;planting trees is one of the most effective actions ordinary citizens can take to mitigate climate change and it will provide many additional benefits for Maui County.&rdquo; Weltman recognized the urgency of the climate crisis particularly facing island environments such as Hawai&lsquo;i with rising sea levels and extreme weather events.</span></p>

\n<p dir="ltr" style="line-height: 1.3800000000000001; margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 0pt;"><span style="font-size: 11pt; font-family: Arial; color: #000000; background-color: transparent; font-weight: 400; font-style: normal; font-variant: normal; text-decoration: none; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap;">Other organizations saw this initiative as of major importance. Common Ground Collectiveʻs President, Ananda Stone commented, &ldquo;As an island community we are particularly vulnerable to climate change and we&rsquo;re already experiencing effects from it. Since trees offer so many ecosystem services, like protecting watersheds, filtering pollutants, enhancing biodiversity, all while sequestering carbon we should absolutely be planting trees.&rdquo;</span></p>

\n<p dir="ltr" style="line-height: 1.3800000000000001; margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 0pt;"><span style="font-size: 11pt; font-family: Arial; color: #000000; background-color: transparent; font-weight: 400; font-style: normal; font-variant: normal; text-decoration: none; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap;">Andy Fox, with Friends of Haleakala believes, &ldquo;There has never been a more urgent time to invest in island resilience and adaptation.&rdquo;</span></p>

id: \n<h3>Please join us, ${Company}, for Lā Hoʻoulu Pae Moku / Retree Hawaii</h3>

\n<p>Individuals, organizations, counties and the State are gearing up to make Hawaii even more beautiful but also more resilient to climate change by planting trees and other plants across the state in November.</p>

\n<p>Plants in general sequester carbon and bind the soil to reduce erosion. Trees provide much-needed shade and cooling in urban and rural areas. Hawaiian native plants stabilize the watershed environments and increase the chances of survival of our endangered forest animals.</p>

\n<p>There will be planting activities across the state in November - at conservation areas, parks, schools, churches, open space areas, hotels and resorts, farms and also at residential complexes such as AOAOs.</p>
\n<p>Read more about ReTree Hawaii and the many supporting organizations at <a href="https://retree-hawaii.org">https://retree-hawaii.org</a>.</p>

\n<p>There are several ways&nbsp;<span style="font-family: -apple-system, BlinkMacSystemFont, 'Segoe UI', Roboto, Oxygen, Ubuntu, Cantarell, 'Open Sans', 'Helvetica Neue', sans-serif;">${Company} can participate:</span></p>

\n<li><span style="font-family: -apple-system, BlinkMacSystemFont, 'Segoe UI', Roboto, Oxygen, Ubuntu, Cantarell, 'Open Sans', 'Helvetica Neue', sans-serif;">Is there a school garden that could use some more plants, or maybe a large lawn that would benefit from shade trees along the edges? In that case, ${Company} can be a planting site for students, teachers and parents. Register the site <a href="https://retree-hawaii.org/planting/sites/add">here</a>. If you need help acquiring plants, there is a link at the bottom of the form to request assistance.</span></li>

\n<li><span style="font-family: -apple-system, BlinkMacSystemFont, 'Segoe UI', Roboto, Oxygen, Ubuntu, Cantarell, 'Open Sans', 'Helvetica Neue', sans-serif;">If there are no appropriate places for planting, maybe a field trip to help plant at one of the other planting sitea around the island? Find a site <a href="https://retree-hawaii.org/planting/sites/showallsites" target="_blank" rel="noopener">here</a>&nbsp;(not many yet this year, but there will be by November)</span></li>

\n<li><span style="font-family: -apple-system, BlinkMacSystemFont, 'Segoe UI', Roboto, Oxygen, Ubuntu, Cantarell, 'Open Sans', 'Helvetica Neue', sans-serif;">And finally, many students can plant at home and upload pictures <a href="https://retree-hawaii.org/planting/sites/homeplant" target="_blank" rel="noopener">here</a> and the plants will be counted towards the ReTree Hawaii goals.</span></li>

\n<p>Registering or signing up will ask you to create an account by selecting an email address and password if you haven't already done so. This is a one-time thing to prevent hackers from changing your information.</p>
\n<p>The <a href="https://retree-hawaii.org/planting/sites">website</a> also has advice on choices of appropriate plants for the different microclimates and elevations.</p>

\n<p>You can see where planting happened last year, along with pictures and reports, on a <a href="https://retree-hawaii.org/planting/map.html?date=2021-01-01&amp;src=allhomes&amp;value=count&amp;to=2021-12-31">map</a> or a <a href="https://retree-hawaii.org/planting/sites/eventgallery?from=2021-01-01&amp;to=2021-12-31">gallery</a>.</p>
\n<p>If you have any questions or run into obstacles registering or signing up, please don't hesitate to contact us at the email address below.</p>
