id: \n<h3><span style="font-size: 18pt;">Press Release: Lā Hoʻoulu Pae Moku / Retree Hawaii 2022 planting campaign to start November 1</span></h3>

\n<p id="docs-internal-guid-45f49f46-7fff-cd80-3e6e-562b77c4b502" dir="ltr" style="line-height: 1.3800000000000001; margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 0pt;"><span style="font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 14pt;"><span style="color: #000000; background-color: transparent; font-weight: bold; font-style: normal; font-variant: normal; text-decoration: none; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap;">Contact: </span><span style="color: #000000; background-color: transparent; font-weight: 400; font-style: normal; font-variant: normal; text-decoration: none; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap;">Rob Weltman, ReTree Hawaii chief organizer</span></span></p>

\n<p dir="ltr" style="line-height: 1.3800000000000001; margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 0pt;"><span style="font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 14pt;"><span style="color: #000000; background-color: transparent; font-weight: bold; font-style: normal; font-variant: normal; text-decoration: none; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap;">Phone:</span><span style="color: #000000; background-color: transparent; font-weight: 400; font-style: normal; font-variant: normal; text-decoration: none; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap;"> (808) 354-0490</span></span></p>

\n<p dir="ltr" style="line-height: 1.3800000000000001; margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 0pt;"><span style="font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 14pt;"><span style="color: #000000; background-color: transparent; font-weight: bold; font-style: normal; font-variant: normal; text-decoration: none; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap;">Email:</span><span style="color: #000000; background-color: transparent; font-weight: 400; font-style: normal; font-variant: normal; text-decoration: none; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap;"> info@retree-hawaii.org</span></span></p>

\n<p dir="ltr" style="line-height: 1.3800000000000001; margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 0pt;"><span style="font-size: 14pt; font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; color: #000000; background-color: transparent; font-weight: bold; font-style: italic; font-variant: normal; text-decoration: underline; text-decoration-skip-ink: none; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap;">For Immediate Release</span></p>

\n<p dir="ltr" style="line-height: 1.3800000000000001; margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 0pt;"><span style="font-size: 14pt; font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; color: #000000; background-color: transparent; font-weight: bold; font-style: normal; font-variant: normal; text-decoration: none; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap;">Lā Ho&lsquo;oulu Paemoku / Retree Hawaii announces a third statewide tree planting initiative in November to make Hawai&lsquo;i more resilient to climate change.</span></p>

\n<p dir="ltr" style="line-height: 1.3800000000000001; margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 0pt;"><span style="font-size: 14pt; font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; color: #000000; background-color: transparent; font-weight: bold; font-style: normal; font-variant: normal; text-decoration: none; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap;">October 27, 2022</span></p>

\n<p dir="ltr" style="line-height: 1.3800000000000001; margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 0pt;"><span style="font-size: 14pt; font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; color: #000000; background-color: transparent; font-weight: 400; font-style: normal; font-variant: normal; text-decoration: none; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap;">Individuals, organizations, and counties are planting trees and other plants across the state throughout the month of November. Every plant contributes to reducing the effects of climate change and beautifying our islands. </span></p>

\n<p dir="ltr" style="line-height: 1.3800000000000001; margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 0pt;"><span style="font-size: 14pt; font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; color: #000000; background-color: transparent; font-weight: 400; font-style: normal; font-variant: normal; text-decoration: none; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap;">This year's campaign follows on last year's successful November planting campaign, when people came together on six of the seven populated Hawaiian islands as well as Kaho&lsquo;olawe to increase the number of trees and other plants binding carbon and releasing oxygen in the state. Over 1,400 volunteers put almost 11,000 plants in the ground at 68 events.</span></p>

\n<p><span style="font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 14pt;">Locations where planting happened last year, along with pictures and reports, can be viewed on a map or gallery at <a href="https://retree-hawaii.org/planting">retree-hawaii.org/planting</a>.</span></p>

\n<p dir="ltr" style="line-height: 1.3800000000000001; margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 0pt;"><span style="font-size: 14pt; font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; color: #000000; background-color: transparent; font-weight: 400; font-style: normal; font-variant: normal; text-decoration: none; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap;">Rob Weltman, chief organizer of ReTree Hawaii, spearheaded the campaign last year stating, &ldquo;Planting trees is one of the most effective actions ordinary citizens can take to mitigate climate change.&rdquo;</span></p>

\n<p dir="ltr" style="line-height: 1.3800000000000001; margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 0pt;"><span style="font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 14pt;">There will be planting activities across the state throughout November this year - at conservation areas, parks, schools, churches, open space areas, hotels and resorts, farms and many others.</span></p>

\n<p><span style="font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 14pt;">Volunteer activities may be directed towards clearing and other ground preparation, wind barriers as well as getting additional plants in the ground.</span></p>

\n<p dir="ltr" style="line-height: 1.3800000000000001; margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 0pt;"><span style="font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 14pt;">Andy Fox, with Friends of Haleakala, says "We are happy to see so many schools participating this year, after the many COVID restrictions kept most schools away for two years. It's a great opportunity to learn how valuable trees are for a healthy environment."</span></p>

\n<p><span style="font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 14pt;">Organizations can register one or more dates for planting activities in November at&nbsp;<a href="https://retree-hawaii.org/planting">retree-hawaii.org/planting</a>. An event may be open to the general public or intended for employees, congregation members or students. Once an event has been registered, volunteers can sign up to come help out if it is an open event.</span></p>

\n<p><span style="font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif;"><span style="font-size: 18.6667px;">Brit Oliphant at Kula Elementary School on Maui reflects on the campaign, saying "Retree Hawaii is a fantastic program. This is the second year in which they have provided our 4th graders at Kula Elementary with a hands on experience with native plants.</span></span></p>

\n<p><span style="font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif;"><span style="font-size: 18.6667px;">This year is particularly special as each student in 4th grade (approx. 80 kids) is getting to take a plant home. In 4th grade, we spend a lot of time teaching our students the importance of preserving native species, so this is a fantastic way for our students to take ownership of their learning while connecting with their community, place, and culture."</span></span></p>

\n<p><span style="font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif;"><span style="font-size: 18.6667px;">St. Anthony School students "got their hands dirty planting native &lsquo;a&rsquo;ali&rsquo;i for ReTree-Hawaii.org outside of their classroom just as we begin our Hawaiian Studies unit on the mahi&rsquo;ai, or farmer, or old Hawaii.&nbsp; What a great way to build a relationship to the aina while also learning about the important role plants play in cooling and cleaning our air!", noted teacher Katherine Wilson.</span></span></p>

\n<p><span style="font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif;"><span style="font-size: 18.6667px;">From Montessori School of Maui, Jeff Friedman underscores the significance for our time: ""If there were ever a moment in the story of human civilization when botanical biodiversity translated to the survival of our species, that precipitous moment is now, in this decade. Putting plants in the hands of keiki and the hands of keiki in the earth results in a beautiful experience of owning that responsibility within the web of life."&nbsp;</span></span></p>

\n<p><span style="font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 14pt;">Those wanting to participate in a planting event can go to&nbsp;<a href="https://retree-hawaii.org/planting">retree-hawaii.org/planting</a>&nbsp;and find a nearby location to sign up for. Work groups and classes are welcome to many of them.</span></p>

\n<p><span style="font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 14pt;">Individuals unable to participate in a planting event can choose to plant at home instead and report the results at&nbsp;<a href="https://retree-hawaii.org/planting">retree-hawaii.org/planting</a>.</span></p>

\n<p><span style="font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 14pt;">Chief organizer Rob Weltman adds, "Our islands are very vulnerable to the effects of climate change. Trees suck up and bind carbon dioxide and give us oxygen in return. They also bind the soil which will help as we face more extreme weather events."</span></p>

\n<p><span style="font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 14pt;"><img style="display: block; margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto;" src="https://retree-hawaii.org/planting/pictures/EkoluMCL@hawaii.rr.com/2020-10-30/IMG_3194.jpg" alt="" width="800" height="600" /></span></p>

\n<p><span style="font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 14pt;">Read more about ReTree Hawaii and the many supporting organizations at <a href="https://retree-hawaii.org">retree-hawaii.org</a>.</span></p>

\n<p><span style="font-size: 12pt; font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif;">Individuals, organizations, counties and the State are gearing up to make Hawaii even more beautiful but also more resilient to climate change by planting trees and other plants across the state in November.</span></p>

\n<p><span style="font-size: 12pt; font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif;">Plants in general sequester carbon and bind the soil to reduce erosion. Trees provide much-needed shade and cooling in urban and rural areas. Hawaiian native plants stabilize the watershed environments and increase the chances of survival of our endangered forest animals.</span></p>

\n<p><span style="font-size: 12pt; font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif;">There will be planting activities across the state in November - at conservation areas, parks, schools, churches, open space areas, hotels and resorts, farms and also at residential complexes such as AOAOs.</span></p>

\n<p><span style="font-size: 12pt; font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif;">Read more about ReTree Hawaii and the many supporting organizations at <a href="https://retree-hawaii.org">https://retree-hawaii.org</a>.</span></p>
\n<p><span style="font-size: 12pt; font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif;">There are several ways&nbsp;${Company} can participate:</span></p>

\n<li style="font-size: 12pt; font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif;"><span style="font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;">Is there a school garden that could use some more plants, or maybe a large lawn that would benefit from shade trees along the edges? In that case, ${Company} can be a planting site for students, teachers and parents. Register the site <a href="https://retree-hawaii.org/planting/sites/add">here</a>. If you need help acquiring plants, there is a link at the bottom of the form to request assistance.</span></li>

\n<li style="font-size: 12pt; font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif;"><span style="font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;">If there are no appropriate places for planting, maybe a field trip to help plant at one of the other planting sitea around the island? Find a site <a href="https://retree-hawaii.org/planting/sites/showallsites" target="_blank" rel="noopener">here</a>&nbsp;(not many yet this year, but there will be by November)</span></li>

\n<li style="font-size: 12pt; font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif;"><span style="font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;">And finally, many students can plant at home and upload pictures <a href="https://retree-hawaii.org/planting/sites/homeplant" target="_blank" rel="noopener">here</a> and the plants will be counted towards the ReTree Hawaii goals.</span></li>

\n<p><span style="font-size: 12pt; font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif;">Registering or signing up will ask you to create an account by selecting an email address and password if you haven't already done so. This is a one-time thing to prevent hackers from changing your information.</span></p>

\n<p><span style="font-size: 12pt; font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif;">The <a href="https://retree-hawaii.org/planting/sites">website</a> also has advice on choices of appropriate plants for the different microclimates and elevations.</span></p>

\n<p><span style="font-size: 12pt; font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif;">You can see where planting happened last year, along with pictures and reports, on a <a href="https://retree-hawaii.org/planting/map.html?src=allhomes&amp;value=count&amp;lastyear" target="_blank" rel="noopener">map</a> or a <a href="https://retree-hawaii.org/planting/sites/eventgallery?lastyear" target="_blank" rel="noopener">gallery</a>.</span></p>

\n<p><span style="font-size: 12pt; font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif;">If you have any questions or run into obstacles registering or signing up, please don't hesitate to contact us at the email address below.</span></p>

\n<p><span style="font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;"><img style="display: block; margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto;" src="https://retree-hawaii.org/planting/pictures/EkoluMCL@hawaii.rr.com/2020-10-30/IMG_3194.jpg" alt="" width="800" height="600"></span></p>

\n<p><span style="font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;">Now is the time for ${company} to register one or more dates for planting activities in November if you haven't already done so. Register the site&nbsp;<a href="https://retree-hawaii.org/planting/sites/add">here</a>.</span></p>

\n<p><span style="font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;">If you would like to participate in the campaign but limit the participants to employees or congregation members and family members, you can still register&nbsp;<a href="https://retree-hawaii.org/planting/sites/add">here</a>. Just set the maximum number of participants to the number of expected staff and then sign up a work group of the same size for your site&nbsp;<a href="https://retree-hawaii.org/planting/sites/showallsites">here</a>. If conditions later allow for outside volunteers as well, you can go back to the&nbsp;<a href="https://retree-hawaii.org/planting/sites/add">site registration</a>&nbsp;and increase the maximum number of participants. You can update the site registration as often as needed.</span></p>

\n<p><span style="font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;">If you are not able to organize planting on land that you manage, other options for participating are to organize a work group to <a href="https://retree-hawaii.org/planting/sites/showallsites">volunteer at another site</a> or to let others know about the upcoming events. Follow us <a href="https://www.facebook.com/ReTreeHawaii">on Facebook</a>!</span></p>

\n<p><span style="font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;">Registering or signing up will ask you to create an account by selecting an email address and password. This is a one-time thing to prevent hackers from changing your information.</span></p>

\n<p><span style="font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;">If you have any questions or run into obstacles registering or signing up, please don't hesitate to contact us at the email address below.</span></p>

\n<p><span style="font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;">Me ke aloha,</span><br><span style="font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;">${sender name}</span></p>

\n<p><span style="font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;">Learn more at:</span><br><span style="font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;"><a href="https://retree-hawaii.org/">https://retree-hawaii.org</a></span></p>

\n<p><span style="font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;">Please reply to:</span><br><span style="font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;"><a href="mailto:info@retree-hawaii.org">info@retree-hawaii.org</a></span></p>

text: <div style="font-family: -apple-system, BlinkMacSystemFont, 'Segoe UI', Roboto, Oxygen, Ubuntu, Cantarell, 'Open Sans', 'Helvetica Neue', sans-serif; background-image: url('https://retree-hawaii.org/wp-content/uploads/2020/09/Andy-Fox-tree-planting-14-cropped.jpg'); background-blend-mode: lighten; background-color: rgba(230,255,230,0.8); padding: .5em; background-size: cover;">

id: \n

\n

Please join us, ${company}, for Lā Hoʻoulu Pae Moku / Retree Hawaii this year

\n

We hope you will join us again in November this year to offer volunteers the opportunity to put plants in the ground - or to hold a private event if volunteers would not be appropriate. It is super-easy to schedule a new event (or more than one) since you have a past event in the system. You can go to See all sites/events I manage and click on "Copy" for a past event, then make any changes for this year (the date, at a minimum), click on "Create Event" and you are done (you will be asked to log in for the first step). Once you have created the new event, there will be a blue "Plants" button in case you would like assistance with plants.

\n

We are offering a free ReTree Hawaii t-shirt to the first 20 organizations to register an event for putting at least ten plants in the ground!
\n

\n

Read more about ReTree Hawaii and the many supporting organizations at https://retree-hawaii.org. See past campaign activities and/or register an event at https://retree-hawaii.org/planting.

\n

There will be planting activities across the state throughout November this year - at conservation areas, parks, schools, churches, open space areas, hotels and resorts, farms and many others.
\n

\n

Now is the time for ${company} to register one or more dates for planting activities in November if you haven't already done so. Register the site here.

\n

Many organizations already have planting events of their own in the works. If yours does, you can get some extra publicity for it by registering it with ReTree Hawaii.

\n

If you would like to participate in the campaign but limit the participants to employees and family members, you can still register here. Just set the maximum number of participants to the number of expected staff and then sign up a work group of the same size for your site here. If conditions later allow for outside volunteers as well, you can go back to the site registration and increase the maximum number of participants. You can update the site registration as often as needed.

\n

If you have forgotten your password, you can reset it when asked to log in.

\n

If you have any questions or run into obstacles registering or signing up, please don't hesitate to contact us at the email address below.
